Trial_Design.evidence: Twenty male participants were hospitalized for 88 days

Participants.evidence: Twenty male participants were hospitalized for 88 days comprised of 14 days of ambulatory baseline, 60 days of 6° head-down tilt bed rest and 14 days of reambulation.

Intervention.evidence: Ten participants each received a control diet or daily polyphenol associated with omega-3, vitamin E, and selenium supplements.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to measure hemolysis before, during and after 60 days of the ground-based spaceflight analog bed rest and the effect of a nutritional intervention

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was endogenous carbon monoxide (CO) elimination measured by gas chromatography.

Result_Outcome.evidence: CO elimination increased after 5, 11, 30, and 57 days of bed rest: +289 ppb (95% CI 101–477 ppb; p = 0.004), +253 ppb (78–427 ppb; p = 0.007), +193 ppb (89–298 ppb; p = 0.001) and +858 ppb (670–1046 ppb; p < 0.000), respectively, compared to baseline.
